80: Title: APS-03: Quality Internal Auditor KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBRs areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity. The Quality Internal Auditor will: Report to the Continuous Improvement Lead / Lead Auditor. On a regular basis, execute risk-based internal audits in accordance with the internal audit plan, ensuring that audited processes comply with associated documentation, applicable standards, regulations, and customer requirements and that resulting audit reports are fair, impartial, and beneficial. Interface regularly with employees and management on issues related to processes, continual improvement, and process deficiencies. Conduct internal audits of Standard Operating Procedures, work Instructions and process flows (including maintenance, logistics, quality, safety, environmental and security programs) at the direction of the Quality Manager. Develop audit plans and interact with functional areas to perform audits in a timely manner. Work with process owners to develop risk-based analysis of operations and processes. Assist teams in Root Cause Analysis utilizing 5-Why and Fishbone methodologies. Make recommendations on changes to the program, work methods and procedures that reflect organizational needs. Assist in the development of Value Stream Maps for APS-03 operations, Identifying process interactions, inputs and outputs. Assist in documenting and revising technical work processes (SOPs, WI, Forms, Process Maps). Coach and motivate team members and auditees. Enhance communication by facilitating team meetings. Work to resolve or assist in the resolution of ISO 9001 QMS related issues. Perform verification of corrective and preventive actions. Identify, report and coach safety and the importance of Zero Harm. Participate in employee QMS training. Participate in APS-03s continuous improvement processes. Provide support in the operation of the organization's ISO 9001 Quality Management System. Assist in development of ISO 9001 audit schedule. Perform other duties as assigned. REQUIREMENTS Must be a U.S. Citizen. Requires an Associates Degree or at least two years of post-high school education in a business, management or quality field of study (this requirement may be offset by five years of previous on the job experience in any quality, business, management or continuous improvement program). Requires a minimum of high school diploma with documented evidence of five years experience in auditing quality management systems and participation in continuous improvement activities. Must have documented experience in an ISO 9001:2015 environment or similar quality management system. Must have excellent interpersonal and written skills. Requires advanced MS Office skills. Must be able to pass a base background check and obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC). Preferred Qualifications: Current ISO 9001:2015 auditor certification. Lean Six Sigma White, Yellow or Green Belt. Prior U.S. Military Service. Physical Requirements: Must be able to stand - between 2 to 3 hours per day. Must be able to walk - between 4 to 5 hours per day. Must be able to Lift - up to 35 lbs. 50 lbs. periodically. Must be able to squat, knell, bend, reach and climb periodically. Must be able to work outside and inside in non-climate-controlled environments. THIS IS NOT A REMOTE ROLE. NO PER DIEM, NO UPLIFT, NO RELOCATION AVAILABLE. In compliance with the U.S. federal governments vaccine mandate, only candidates who are fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or have a reasonable accommodation or approved medical exception will be considered for this position.
